intro: Cicutaria dioica, commonly known as the common waterparsley, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is an annual herb that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It is characterized by its distinct, hollow stems and its ability to thrive in moist environments. Cicutaria dioica is often found along the edges of ponds, streams, and other water bodies.
